py-trelliscope
  • Meta Variables API
  • Edit on GitHub

Meta Variables APIïƒ

Meta variables (cognostics) provide metadata about each panel that enables filtering, sorting, and labeling in the viewer.

Base Classïƒ

class trelliscope.MetaVariable(varname, label=None, desc=None)[source]ïƒ

Bases: object

Base class for meta variables (cognostics).

Meta variables describe panel metadata and enable interactive filtering and sorting in the trelliscope viewer.

Parameters:

  • varname (str) â€“ Column name in DataFrame.

  • label (str, optional) â€“ Display label for viewer. Defaults to varname if not provided.

  • desc (str, optional) â€“ Description for tooltip in viewer.

  • type (str) â€“ Meta variable type identifier.

varnameïƒ

Column name.

Type:

str

labelïƒ

Display label.

Type:

str

descïƒ

Description.

Type:

str

typeïƒ

Type identifier.

Type:

str

varname: strïƒ
label: Optional[str]ïƒ
desc: Optional[str]ïƒ
type: strïƒ
__attrs_post_init__()[source]ïƒ

Set label to varname if not provided.

to_dict()[source]ïƒ

Convert meta variable to JSON-serializable dictionary.

Returns:

Dictionary representation matching displayInfo.json schema.

Return type:

dict

Examples

>>> meta = FactorMeta("category", levels=["A", "B", "C"])
>>> meta.to_dict()
{'varname': 'category', 'label': 'category', 'type': 'factor', ...}
classmethod from_series(series, varname=None, **kwargs)[source]ïƒ

Create meta variable from pandas Series with type inference.

Parameters:

  • series (pd.Series) â€“ Data series to infer from.

  • varname (str, optional) â€“ Column name. Uses series.name if not provided.

  • **kwargs â€“ Additional parameters for specific meta type.

Returns:

Inferred meta variable instance.

Return type:

MetaVariable

Raises:

ValueError â€“ If varname cannot be determined from series.name or parameter.

Method generated by attrs for class MetaVariable.

Meta Variable Typesïƒ

FactorMetaïƒ

Categorical variables with defined levels.

Bases: MetaVariable

Categorical meta variable with defined levels.

Parameters:

Monetary values with formatting.

Bases: MetaVariable

Currency/monetary meta variable.

Type Inferenceïƒ

Automatic type inference from pandas Series.

trelliscope.infer_meta_from_series(series, varname=None, **kwargs)[source]ïƒ

Automatically infer and create appropriate MetaVariable from pandas Series.

Inference rules: - datetime64[ns] without time component â†’ DateMeta - datetime64[ns] with timezone OR time values â†’ TimeMeta - Numeric dtypes (int, float) â†’ NumberMeta - Categorical, object, string â†’ FactorMeta - Boolean â†’ FactorMeta with levels [â€œFalseâ€, â€œTrueâ€]

Parameters:

  • series (pd.Series) â€“ Data series to infer type from.

  • varname (str, optional) â€“ Variable name. Uses series.name if not provided.

  • **kwargs â€“ Additional parameters passed to specific meta type constructor.

Returns:

Appropriate meta variable instance based on inferred type.

Return type:

MetaVariable

Raises:

ValueError â€“ If series is empty or varname cannot be determined.

Examples

>>> import pandas as pd
>>> from trelliscope.inference import infer_meta_from_series

>>> # Numeric series â†’ NumberMeta
>>> series = pd.Series([1.5, 2.7, 3.9], name="values")
>>> meta = infer_meta_from_series(series)
>>> meta.type
'number'

>>> # Categorical series â†’ FactorMeta
>>> series = pd.Series(["A", "B", "C"], name="category")
>>> meta = infer_meta_from_series(series)
>>> meta.type
'factor'

>>> # Datetime series â†’ DateMeta or TimeMeta
>>> series = pd.Series(pd.date_range("2024-01-01", periods=3), name="dates")
>>> meta = infer_meta_from_series(series)
>>> meta.type
'date'
trelliscope.infer_meta_dict(df, columns=None)[source]ïƒ

Infer meta variables for multiple DataFrame columns.

Parameters:

  • df (pd.DataFrame) â€“ DataFrame to infer from.

  • columns (list of str, optional) â€“ Columns to infer. Defaults to all columns.

Returns:

Dictionary mapping column names to MetaVariable instances.

Return type:

dict

Examples

>>> import pandas as pd
>>> from trelliscope.inference import infer_meta_dict

>>> df = pd.DataFrame({
...     'id': [1, 2, 3],
...     'category': ['A', 'B', 'C'],
...     'value': [1.5, 2.7, 3.9]
... })
>>> metas = infer_meta_dict(df)
>>> list(metas.keys())
['id', 'category', 'value']
>>> metas['value'].type
'number'

Examplesïƒ

Creating Meta Variablesïƒ

from trelliscope import FactorMeta, NumberMeta, DateMeta

# Factor (categorical)
category_meta = FactorMeta(
    varname="category",
    label="Category",
    levels=["A", "B", "C"]
)

# Number
value_meta = NumberMeta(
    varname="value",
    label="Value",
    digits=2,
    locale=True
)

# Date
date_meta = DateMeta(
    varname="date",
    label="Date"
)

Auto-Inferenceïƒ

import pandas as pd
from trelliscope import Display

df = pd.DataFrame({
    'plot': [fig1, fig2],
    'category': pd.Categorical(['A', 'B']),
    'value': [10.5, 20.3],
    'date': pd.to_datetime(['2025-01-01', '2025-01-02'])
})

# Automatic inference
display = Display(df, name="auto_example")
display.infer_metas()  # Infers factor, number, date types

Manual Overrideïƒ

from trelliscope import Display, NumberMeta

display = Display(df, name="manual_example")

# Override inference for specific column
display.add_meta_def(NumberMeta("value", digits=1))

# Infer rest automatically
display.infer_metas()

Currency Formattingïƒ

from trelliscope import CurrencyMeta

price_meta = CurrencyMeta(
    varname="price",
    label="Price (USD)",
    code="USD",
    digits=2
)

Hyperlinksïƒ

from trelliscope import HrefMeta

link_meta = HrefMeta(
    varname="url",
    label="Documentation Link"
)

Type Mappingïƒ

Pandas dtype to Meta type inference:

Pandas dtype

Meta type

category

FactorMeta

int64, float64

NumberMeta

datetime64

TimeMeta

object (dates)

DateMeta or TimeMeta

object (strings)

FactorMeta (if few unique values)

See Alsoïƒ

  • Display API - Display class using meta variables

  • Type Inference API - Type inference details
